page.title: 06CHILDRENS LEISURE SURVEY
page.content:
190 children took part in a survey of how they spent their spare time involved in organised leisure activities. They were asked if they went to any clubs which taught specific activities.The results were:
Gymnastics 26% Birdwatching 4% Music 18% Tennis 4% Swimming 18% Sailing 3% Judo 16% Trampolining 3% Disco dancing 14% Diving 3% Football 9% Karate 2% Ballet 6% Jujitsu 2% Horse riding 6% Squash 1% Badminton 6% Cricket 1% Ballroom dancing 5%
Average of 1.5 clubs per child. Of the 35 children who have music lessons 60% learn the piano. 31 out of 190 do not belong to a club or other organisation
